meanings.definition: A curved piece of wood or metal forming the side of a barrel or bucket.
meanings.sent1: The old barrel had sturdy wingbows that held it together.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter crafted the wingbows for the new barrel.
meanings.sent3: When the wingbows started singing, the barrel rolled away in surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed like the clinking of wingbows in a barrel.
meanings.sent5: The shiny wingbows gleamed in the sunlight, making the barrel look elegant.

meanings.definition: A curved piece of wood or metal forming the side of a barrel or bucket.
meanings.sent1: We need to replace the wingbows on this barrel to keep it from falling apart.
meanings.sent2: The wingbows on the bucket were rusted and needed repair.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the wingbows as a slide down the barrel.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as the polished wingbows on the barrel.
meanings.sent5: The sound of rain on the wingbows created a soothing rhythm on the barrel.

meanings.definition: A curved piece of wood or metal forming the side of a barrel or bucket.
meanings.sent1: The wingbows of the barrel creaked as it was rolled across the floor.
meanings.sent2: He examined the wingbows carefully before purchasing the barrel.
meanings.sent3: The cat peeked out from behind the wingbows of the barrel, curious about the noise.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight cast shadows that danced along the wingbows of the barrel.
meanings.sent5: The scent of flowers mingled with the earthy smell of the wingbows on the barrel.
